revised_title: On the Illumination of Lines of Molecular Pressure and the Trajectory of Molecules
tldr: The author examines the dark space surrounding the negative pole of a vacuum tube when a spark from an induction coil is passed through it. He investigates the effects of varying intensity, gas type, and exhaustion levels on the molecular disturbance and its illumination. The study also explores the convergence of molecular rays and the nature of green phosphorescent light produced under high exhaustion levels.
